<h1 style="text-align: center;"><b>Introduction to data science in R</b></h1>
<hr>

<p>In this weekly workshop we explore the management of data using Program R,focusing on the stucture and linguistics of data in R. This workshop is not intended to teach specific R tasks -- our goal is to explore how to think about data in new ways. 
<img src = "rWorkshop/images/dsWorkflowOverview.png"
  style = "float:right;
  padding-right: 0px;
  width: 350px;">
Through this process, participants are expected to develop a flexible skillset for managing and exploring data.</p>

<p>This web page will act as a clearinghouse for the lessons of this workshop. Each lesson has accompanying hyperlinks. The links are divided into the following types:</p>
<ul>
<li><b>Presentation website</b>: Website that accompanies the video or in-person presentation.</li>
<li><b>Worksheet website</b>: Website with written-out instructions and exercises associated with a presentation. These are made available after the presentation is given.</li>
<li><b>Lesson code</b>: The R code that accompanies a lesson (<i>Note: This link will download the file</i>).</li>
<li><b>Homework website</b>: Website with instructions for the homework.</li>
<li><b>Homework code</b>: The R code that accompanies a homework assignment (<i>Note: This link will download the file</i>).</li>
</ul>

<p>The video for presentations can be found on my twitter feed at: <a href = "https://twitter.com/bsevans_unc">@bsevans_unc</a>.

<p>Please email me with any questions at <a href="mailto:evansbr@si.edu">evansbr@si.edu</a>.
<hr>
